params.data: Passes a flag for an initial creation event
params.from: The address sending the membership token
params.ids: An array of membership token ids to be transfered
params.operator: The address that initiated the action
params.to: The address recieveing the membership token

checkTransaction(address,uint256,bytes,u.details: This will be called by the safe at execution time time

params.baseGas: Gas costs that are independent of the transaction execution(e.g. base transaction fee, signature check, payment of the refund)
params.gasPrice: Gas price that should be used for the payment calculation.
params.gasToken: Token address (or 0 if ETH) that is used for the payment.
params.refundReceiver: Address of receiver of gas payment (or 0 if tx.origin).
params.safeTxGas: Gas that should be used for the Safe transaction.
params.signatures: Packed signature data ({bytes32 r}{bytes32 s}{uint8 v})

constructor.details: Will instantiate safe teller with gnosis master and proxy addresses

params._controllerRegistry: The address of the ControllerRegistry contract
params._memberToken: The address of the MemberToken contract

params._admin: The address of the pod admin
params._label: label hash of pod name (i.e labelhash('mypod'))
params._members: The addresses of the members of the pod
params.threshold: The number of members that are required to sign a transaction

createPodWithSafe(address,address,bytes3.details: Used to create a pod with an existing safeWill automatically distribute membership NFTs to current safe members

params._admin: The address of the pod admin
params._label: label hash of pod name (i.e labelhash('mypod'))

params.label: - labelhash of pod ENS name, i.e., `labelhash("mypod")`

migratePodController(uint256,address,add.details: This will nullify all pod state on this controllerUpdate state on _newControllerUpdate controller to _newController in Safe and MemberToken

params._newController: The address of the new pod controller
params._podId: The id number of the pod
params._prevModule: The module that points to the orca module in the safe's ModuleManager linked list

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setPodModuleLock(uint256,bool).details: Allows admin to unlock the safe modules and allow them to be edited by members

params._isLocked: true - pod modules cannot be added/removed
params._podId: The id number of the pod

params._isTransferLocked: The address of the new pod admin
params._podId: The id number of the pod

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params._newAdmin: The address of the new pod admin
params._podId: The id number of the pod

updatePodState(uint256,address,address).details: This is called by another version of controller to migrate a pod to this versionWill only accept calls from registered controllersCan only be called once.

params._podAdmin: The address of the pod admin
params._podId: The id number of the pod

disableModule(address,address,address,ad.notice: Removes the reverse registrar entry and disables module. Intended as clean up during the safe ejection process. Note that an already ejected safe cannot clear the reverse registry entry.

ejectSafe(uint256,bytes32,address).notice: Ejects a safe from the Orca ecosystem. Also handles clean up for safes that have already been ejected. Note that the reverse registry entry cannot be cleaned up if the safe has already been ejected.
